wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core

Interface ImageCore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ResourceCore
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ImageCoreGray8, ImageThresholding
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImageCoreGray8IJ, ImageCoreIJ, ImageThresholdingIJ

    public interface ImageCore
extends ResourceCore
    The ImageCore class is a wrapper for the ImageJ library's image data and its basic operations. The class does not expose all functionalities of ImagePlus, but rather a selection of fundamental operations.
    Author:
    Ngoungoure Nsapngue and Remy Malgoures

      • getSize

        int getSize(CoordinateAxis axis)
        Retrieves the size (number voxels in one coordinate's dimension) of the image in pixels, for a given coordinate axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis for which the edge length of the image (in voxels) should be returned
        Returns:
        the number of slices of the image

      • getBitDepth

        int getBitDepth()
        Returns:
        the number of bits of each color value (8, 16, 24 (RGB) or 32).

      • getWhiteValue

        int getWhiteValue()
        Allows to retrieve the maximage gray level given an image representation. This is 255 for a one byte per component (e.g.GRAY8) and 65535 for a 2 bytes per component (e.g. GRAY16)
        Returns:
        The maximal gray level value, given the bit depth of this image

      • setCurrentZ

        void setCurrentZ(int zCoord)
        Sets the z-value of the current slice (for use with getPixel(int, int)) and setPixel(int, int, int). For cache optimization reasons, z-values should not be access randomly, but the slices should better be processed one by one. For the reason, changing the z value, which is set at each new slice accessed, is a relatively expensive operationand can be made explicit.
        Parameters:
        zCoord - the id (z-value) of the new current slice, between zero and (getDepth()-1).

      • getCurrentZ

        int getCurrentZ()
        Returns:
        the z-value of the current slice, between zero and (getDepth()-1).

      • deleteMemory

        void deleteMemory()
        allows to release the memory of the slices of the image, making the image unusable.

      • getPixel

        int getPixel(int x,
             int y)
        Returns the gray level value of a pixel on the current stack of the image, previously selected by the #setCurrentSlice(int) method
        Parameters:
        x - the (integer valued) x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the (integer valued) y coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        the gray level value of a pixel on the current stack of the image
        See Also:
        setCurrentZ(int)

      • setPixel

        void setPixel(int x,
              int y,
              int value)
        Sets the grey level or RGB value of a pixel on the current stack of the image, previously selected by the setCurrentZ(int)) method.
        Parameters:
        x - the (integer valued) x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the (integer valued) y coordinate of the pixel
        value - the grey level value to set for the pixel.
        See Also:
        setCurrentZ(int)

      • setVoxel

        void setVoxel(int x,
              int y,
              int z,
              int value)
        Sets the gray level value of a voxel on the current stack of the image. The method checks of the z-value (slice id) has changed with respect to the previous access, and in that case updates the z-value (setCurrentZ(int). Note that accessing z-values (different slices) randomly is expensive and that slices should rather be processed one by one.
        Parameters:
        x - the (integer valued) x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the (integer valued) y coordinate of the pixel
        z - the (integer valued) z coordinate of the pixel
        value - the gray level value to set for the pixel.

      • setVoxelFloat

        void setVoxelFloat(int x,
                   int y,
                   int z,
                   float floatValue)
        Sets the gray level value of a voxel on the current stack of the image. The method checks of the z-value (slice id) has changed with respect to the previous access, and in that case updates the z-value (setCurrentZ(int). Note that accessing z-values (different slices) randomly is expensive and that slices should rather be processed one by one. This method should be used exclusively for methods intended to work with image with floating point representation of gray levels.
        Parameters:
        x - the (integer valued) x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the (integer valued) y coordinate of the pixel
        z - the (integer valued) z coordinate of the pixel
        floatValue - the gray level value to set for the pixel.

                    int y,
                    int z)
        Retrieves the gray level value of a voxel on the current stack of the image. Note that accessing z-values (different slices) randomly is expensive and that slices should rather be processed one by one. This method should be used exclusively for methods intended to work with image with floating point representation of gray levels.
        Parameters:
        x - the (integer valued) x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the (integer valued) y coordinate of the pixel
        z - the (integer valued) z coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        the gray level value of the voxel.

      • setVoxel

        void setVoxel(VoxelShort voxel,
              int value)
        Sets the gray level value of a voxel on the current stack of the image. The method checks of the z-value (slice id) has changed with respect to the previous access, and in that case updates the z-value (setCurrentZ(int). Note that accessing z-values (different slices) randomly is expensive and that slices should rather be processed one by one.
        Parameters:
        voxel - the voxel at which to set the gray level.
        value - the gray level value to set for the pixel.

      • getVoxel

        int getVoxel(VoxelShort voxel)
        Retrieves the gray level value of a voxel on the current stack of the image. Warning: the internal use of a double for the grey level value should be removed in the future. Note that accessing z-values (different slices) randomly is expensive and that slices should rather be processed one by one.
        Parameters:
        voxel - the voxel at which to retrive the gray level.
        Returns:
        the gray level value of the voxel.

      • getImageSignPolicyEmbed

        ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric getImageSignPolicyEmbed(boolean allowSignedValues)
        Factory to generate an instance allowing to perform linear combinations with other images, or similar operations such as set constant values. There are mainly two policies to perform these operations: with signed values or with unsigned values. Due to unsupported unsigned values in java, the implementation of some operations differs depending on the policy, thus leading to two derived classes. Note that no change in the values is made at instantiation. Only some operations such as absolute values and subtraction have a different implementation with the unsigned and signed policies. THE USER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR RELEVANT INPUT IMAGE FORMAT FOR SIGNED/UNSIGNED VALUES. Use ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) if necessary to ensure this precondition.
        Parameters:
        allowSignedValues - If true, the gray levels MUST BE arranged to start in the middle of the range of a short value, in order to support signed operations.
        Returns:
        The instance of the relevant linear combinations implementer
        See Also:
        ImageEmbedSigned, Note that the input image is assumed to hold values allowing, to some extent, the linear operations to be performed without incurring overflows. Use {@link wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation.ImageSignPolicyEmbed#getImageEmbedding(boolean, int)} if necessary to ensure this precondition.

      • getImageSignPolicyEmbed

        ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric getImageSignPolicyEmbed()
        Factory to generate an instance allowing to perform linear combinations with other images, or similar operations such as set constant values. This method is the default for getImageSignPolicyEmbed(boolean) which provides the UNSIGNED POLICY (allowSignedValues = false) There are mainly two policies to perform these operations: with signed values or with unsigned values. Due to unsupported unsigned values in java, the implementation of some operations differs depending on the policy, thus leading to two derived classes.
        Returns:
        The instance of the relevant linear combinations implementer
        See Also:
        ImageEmbedSigned, *

        Returns:
        an instance of the class implementing the Image Domain Operations involving this instance.

      • getImageDifferential

        ImageDifferentialOperatorGeneric getImageDifferential(boolean autoAllowSignedValues,
                                                      int inputImageMarginX,
                                                      int inputImageMarginY,
                                                      int inputImageMarginZ,
                                                      BufferEnlargementPolicy enlargementPolicy,
                                                      int embedBitDepth)
        Retrieves an instance of the class implementing general convolution Operators (e.g. Blur, Gradient, Laplacian, Partial Differentials...) for this image. The operators can be composed using the Cascade Design Pattern.
        Parameters:
        autoAllowSignedValues - If true, the gray levels are shifted to start in the middle of the range of a short value.
        inputImageMarginX - Margin breadth to enlarge the input image in X
        inputImageMarginY - Margin breadth to enlarge the input image in Y
        inputImageMarginZ - Margin breadth to enlarge the input image in Z
        enlargementPolicy - Policy to fill the new margins with color
        embedBitDepth - The target bit depth for the image to be embedded using the method ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) thus allowing values to be added AND subtracted without overflow. Otherwise, the image is assumed to already allow values to be added AND subtracted without overflow.
        Returns:
        an instance of the class implementing the ImageDifferential interface for this image

      • getImageDifferential

        ImageDifferentialOperatorGeneric getImageDifferential()
        Retrieves an instance of the class implementing general convolution Operators (e.g. Blur, Gradient, Laplacian, Partial Differentials...) for this image. The operators can be composed using the Cascade Design Pattern. The output image is automatically embedded using ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int). The gray levels are shifted to start in the middle of the range of a short value (same as getImageDifferential(boolean, int, int, int, BufferEnlargementPolicy, int) with autoAllowSignedValues=true).
        Returns:
        an instance of the class implementing the ImageDifferential interface for this image

      • getImageThresholding

        ImageThresholding getImageThresholding()
        Retrieves an instance of the class implementing thresholding (e.g. Otsu) for this image.
        Returns:
        an instance of the class implementing the ImageThresholdinginterface for this image

        Retrieves an instance of the class implementing drawing (e.g. text drawing) within the image.
        Returns:
        an instance of the class implementing the ImageDraw for this image
